title: James Nasmyth, Engineer: An Autobiography
author: Nasmyth, James
snippet: Many of these paintings are still to be found in the houses of thegentry in Scotland. Good examples of his art are to be seen at MintoHouse, the seat of the Earl of Minto, and at Dalmeny Park, the seat ofthe Earl of Rosebery.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: (4) On the right, Barnton House (Hon. Mrs. Ramsay). (4-^) Cross the Almond by Cramond Bridge, and pass on the left New Saughton (Lord Aberdour), and Craigiehall (Hope Vere, Esq.) On the shore is the vilhige of Cramond, and on the right the entrance to Dalmeny Park, the seat of the Earl of Rosebery. The grounds of Dalmeny slope beautifully to the sea, and present views of the most pleasing description.

title: Rambles in America, past and present.
author: Pairpoint, Alfred J.
snippet: The illustrious visitors were the guests of the Karl and Countess of Roseberry, of Dalmeny Park, situated about six miles from Edinburgh. This estate is very large, comprising  many miles of forest, wood, and deer land, also acres of cultivated gardens.
